headline: Podcast: Science and comedy collide at the Festival of the Spoken Nerd
text: Science Weekly takes a comic turn when we meet the trio behind Festival of the Spoken Nerd: Helen Arney (who provides our theme tune and musical interludes on the show), Matt Parker and Steve Mould. The festival is a touring variety show that entertains and educates science-loving audiences around the UK.  Helen, Matt and Steve also discuss this week's science news with Alok Jha, including the discovery of the Majorana particle and why the world's penguin population seems to have suddenly increased. Finally, Alok meets Dick Taverne, founder of Sense About Science, to discuss his forthcoming lecture "What has science ever done for us?" The lecture marks the 10th birthday of the organisation, which campaigns tirelessly for greater public understanding of science. Listen to the entire lecture in our Science Weekly Extra podcast.
